Find the foot of the perpendicular from the point $A = (1,8,4)$ to the line passing through $B = (0,-1,3)$ and $C = (2,-3,-1).$
inference:
Solution:
First, we find the direction vector of the line:
\begin{align*}
\overrightarrow{BC} &= \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ -3 \\ -1 \end{pmatrix} - \begin{pmatrix} 0 \\ -1 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix} \\
&= \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ -2 \\ -4 \end{pmatrix}.
\end{align*}
Let $D$ be the foot of the perpendicular from $A$ to line $BC$.  Then $\overrightarrow{AD}$ is orthogonal to $\overrightarrow{BC}$.  Let $D = (x,y,z)$.  Then
\[\overrightarrow{AD} = \begin{pmatrix} x - 1 \\ y - 8 \\ z - 4 \end{pmatrix}.\]Since $\overrightarrow{AD}$ is orthogonal to $\overrightarrow{BC}$,
\[\overrightarrow{AD} \cdot \overrightarrow{BC} = 0.\]This gives us the equation
\[2(x - 1) - 2(y - 8) - 4(z - 4) = 0.\]Also, $D$ lies on line $BC$, so
\[\begin{pmatrix} x \\ y \\ z \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 0 \\ -1 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix} + t \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ -2 \\ -4 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 2t \\ -1 - 2t \\ 3 - 4t \end{pmatrix}\]for some scalar $t$.  Substituting into the equation $2(x - 1) - 2(y - 8) - 4(z - 4) = 0$, we get
\[2(2t - 1) - 2(-1 - 2t - 8) - 4(3 - 4t - 4) = 0.\]This simplifies to $24t - 12 = 0$, so $t = \frac{1}{2}$.  Then
\[D = \begin{pmatrix} 2t \\ -1 - 2t \\ 3 - 4t \end{pmatrix} = \boxed{\left( 1, -2, 1 \right)}.\]Final Answer: $\boxed{\left( 1, -2, 1 \right)}$. I hope it is correct.
